ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Musa experienced in himself a feeling of alarm.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And Moses felt afraid within himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So Moses' heart was filled with fear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And Moosa sensed fear in his heart.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So Musa conceived fear in himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So Musa conceived in his mind a fear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and Moses conceived a fear within him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And Moses conceived a fear in his mind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and in his heart Moses became apprehensive,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then a kind of fear in his soul Musa felt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then Moses felt a fear within his heart.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So Musa (Moses) conceived a fear in himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So Moses felt apprehensive within himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:67] And Moses sensed fear within himself, that is to say, he feared that if [the effect of] their sorcery was of the same kind as his miracle, he would become suspect in people’s minds and they would not believe in him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And Moses conceived a fear in his mind) Moses concealed his fear of them. He was afraid that they would kill all those who believed in him, if he failed to defeat them.
